title: Track crypto prices & FX rates with CoinGecko & ExchangeRate-API to Notion
description:
# üìä Log BTC/ETH Prices and USD Exchange Rates to Notion (Hourly)

## üìå Overview
This workflow automatically logs live **crypto prices (Bitcoin & Ethereum)** and **fiat exchange rates (USD‚ÜíEUR / USD‚ÜíNGN)** into a Notion database every hour. Each entry becomes a new row in your Notion dashboard, letting you visualize currency and crypto trends side by side.  

It‚Äôs perfect for traders, analysts, and anyone who wants a **single source of truth in Notion** without needing multiple apps open. With hourly updates, you‚Äôll have a clean data history for building rollups, trend graphs, or financial dashboards.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it works
1. **Schedule Trigger** ‚Äî runs every hour (adjustable via cron).  
2. **HTTP Request (ExchangeRate-API)** ‚Äî fetches USD-base FX rates (no API key required).  
3. **HTTP Request (CoinGecko)** ‚Äî fetches BTC & ETH prices + 24h % change (no API key required).  
4. **Merge** ‚Äî combines both payloads.  
5. **Code (v2)** ‚Äî formats a Notion-ready JSON payload with the correct fields.  
6. **Notion Node** ‚Äî creates a new page in your database with mapped properties.

**Example Row in Notion:**  
Title: *Crypto+FX ‚Äî 2025-09-08 09:00*  
BTC: 112,417 | BTC_24h: +1.22%  
ETH: 4,334.57 | ETH_24h: +1.33%  
USD‚ÜíEUR: 0.854 | USD‚ÜíNGN: ‚Ç¶1,524.54  

---

## üõ† Setup Guide

### 1) Create the Notion database
- In Notion, create a new **database (Table view)**.  
- Add these columns with matching property types:

| Column     | Property Type |
|------------|---------------|
| Title      | Title         |
| BTC        | Number        |
| BTC_24h    | Number        |
| ETH        | Number        |
| ETH_24h    | Number        |
| USD_EUR    | Number        |
| USD_NGN    | Number        |

### 2) Connect Notion in n8n
- In the **Notion ‚ÄúCreate Page‚Äù node**, connect with your **Notion OAuth2 credentials**.  
- On first use, you‚Äôll be redirected to authorize n8n with your Notion workspace.  
- Copy your **Database ID** (from the Notion URL) and paste it into the node.

### 3) Map the Code output
- The Code node outputs JSON fields: `BTC`, `BTC_24h`, `ETH`, `ETH_24h`, `USD_EUR`, `USD_NGN`.  
- In the Notion node, map each property:  
  - `BTC` ‚Üí `{{$json.BTC}}`  
  - `BTC_24h` ‚Üí `{{$json.BTC_24h}}`  
  - `ETH` ‚Üí `{{$json.ETH}}`  
  - `ETH_24h` ‚Üí `{{$json.ETH_24h}}`  
  - `USD_EUR` ‚Üí `{{$json.USD_EUR}}`  
  - `USD_NGN` ‚Üí `{{$json.USD_NGN}}`

### 4) Test
- Run the workflow once.  
- Confirm that a new page is added to your Notion database with all values filled.

---

## üéõ Customization
- **Cadence:** change the schedule to 10 minutes, 4 hours, or daily depending on your needs.  
- **Extra coins:** add more IDs (e.g., `solana`, `bnb`) in the CoinGecko call and update the Code node.  
- **Extra FX pairs:** expand from ExchangeRate-API (e.g., USD‚ÜíGBP, USD‚ÜíZAR).  
- **Notion dashboards:** use rollups, charts, and linked databases for trend visualization.  
- **Formatting:** add emojis, colors, or sections in your Notion view for clarity.  

---

## üß© Troubleshooting
- **Page not created:** verify Database ID and ensure the Notion API integration has access.  
- **Empty fields:** check that property names in Notion exactly match those used in the Code node.  
- **Wrong data type:** make sure properties are set as **Number**, not Text.  
- **Rate limits:** CoinGecko and ExchangeRate-API are free but may rate-limit if called too often; keep cadence reasonable (hourly recommended).

---
